episodes.title: EP. 76 DON'T CALL IT A STATE OF THE UNION
episodes.summary: What does a sharp New York gal from a Trump-voting Wisconsin county think about the President's first speech to Congress? And about Syrians? And about identity politics? And about end-of-life health care for greedy baby boomers? Why, Josh digs into it all in this Not-a-State-of-the-Union post mortem with the Daily Beast's Erin Gloria Ryan, host of the Girl Friday podcast. Lap it up, humans!

episodes.title: EP. 75 TRUMP & AUSTRALIA
episodes.summary: Who cares about Australia? Well, Trump does, a bit. And Josh does, a lot. And so does Aussie journalist and all-round clever funny guy James West, of Mother Jones magazine in New York. Together, they explain Australia's refugee policy, the kerfuffle between Trump and the Aussie P.M., and they solve America's immigration problem. You're welcome, humans.

episodes.title: EP. 74 DECONSTRUCTING MILO
episodes.summary: A Trump supporter and a anti-Trumper walk into a bar to discuss Milo Yiannopoulos, masculinity and the backlash from the Left… and get derailed into discussing immigration, assimilation, bigotry, neoliberalism and whether The West Is The Best. How will it go? Can we bridge the conversational chasm? Tune in to find out on this all-new episode… of #WethePeople LIVE!

episodes.title: EP. 73 MYQ KAPLAN THE PHILOSOPHER COMIC KING
episodes.summary: Free will! Marxism! Moral philosophy! Cruelty to animals! Cruelty to Nazis! Sam Harris! Peter Singer! This week, Josh takes a break from politics in a wide-ranging, thought-provoking dialog with the wisest comedian we know, Myq Kaplan. The two of them ponder veganism, ayahuasca, factory farms, refugees, and the inexplicable narcissism of the Orange President (okay, of course they don’t avoid politics 100%.) Myq’s new comedy album, No Kidding, drops on February 17th. Buckle up, humans, for this non-stop ride to brainy-town.

episodes.title: EP. 72 IS TRUMP STAGING A COUP?
episodes.summary: Probably not. Who knows? Maybe Medium.com does. Several articles have gone viral on Facebook with titles like "“Trial balloon for a coup." Might the chaos of Trump's first two weeks be a deception? Whom should we believe, dear listener? Why, Josh! He gets down with the writer of one of Medium's most viral articles, "The Immigration Ban is a Headfake, and We’re Falling For It" -- the successful Silicon Valley entrepreneur and CEO, Jake Fuentes. Democracy! Fake news! World affairs! Steve Bannon! It's all sexy. It's all here. Enjoy.

episodes.title: BONUS: IMMIGRATION RANT
episodes.summary: Josh has a lot to say. About 13 minutes worth of thoughts.

episodes.title: Ep. 71 IS IT OKAY TO PUNCH A NAZI?
episodes.summary:
In such a crazy week debating really does need saving and luckily this week's guest made debate great again. Josh is joined by Sabrina Jalees, Josh Androsky and Eliza Skinner. 

@JOSHZEPPS @WTP_LIVE

episodes.title: EP. 70 TSAR TRUMP & OUR DOOMED MEDIA
episodes.summary:
After a relaxing holiday hiatus, we're back! 

And so is America's political shitstorm. Amid sordid rumors about his links to Russia, Trump held his first press conference as president-elect. Today, Josh is joined from Moscow by Russian dissident journalist Alexey Kovalev to discuss Putin's press conferences, fake news, and the future of the media in a strongman state (not before, of course, Josh dishes his thoughts on golden showers and the dreaded dossier.) 

Welcome back, humans!

@WTP_LIVE @JOSHZEPPS

episodes.title: Ep. 69 JOSH GETS JADED
episodes.summary:
Welcome back humans. 

Back when we were young, supple and innocent, Josh took the show to Philly. We have finally recovered from the disturbing news we received while there and are now ready to release this episode... I'm being semi serious, but also you'll laugh. Promise. 

#MakeDebateHealthy
@WTP_LIVe @JOSHZEPPS

episodes.title: Ep. 68 Andy Kindler & Josh Have a Ball
episodes.summary:
Welcome back, humans. Do you need a break from the storm? Something personal and fun? Well, we did. So enjoy this conversation between legendary comic Andy Kindler and Josh.

@WTP_LIVE @JOSHZEPPS

episodes.title: Ep. 67 CARRIE & SAMHITA: A Republican Feminist & a Democratic Feminist Walk Into a Bar
episodes.summary:
Josh is joined by white Republican female human Carrie Sheffield and non-white Democratic female human Samhita Mukopadhyay. But we don't see labels, coz we're, like, so totes beyond identity. Does Trump herald the end of identity politics, or its resurgence? Oh, and what about his Cabinet picks? And his tweets? Dive in.

@JoshZepps @WTP_LIVE

episodes.title: Ep. 66 FELIX SALMON's SOLEMN SONG
episodes.summary:
Welcome back humans!

Fusion's financial megawhizz breaks down the breakdown of the American working class. Globalization? NAFTA? China? What to do? And what will Trumponomics look like?

@WTP_LIVE @JOSHZEPPS

#MakeDebateHealthy

episodes.title: Ep. 65 Where To Now, Señor Trump?
episodes.summary:
Welcome back humans!

Now that the election dust has settled Josh delivers a 21 minute speech like you've never heard on this show before.

Then our favorite socialist, Harvey Kaye, and our favorite libertarian, Kmele Foster, wrestle with the future of the Democratic and Republican parties, and the Trump Administration. What happened? What will happen? And where does this all leave the rest of us?

 #MakeDebateHealthy

@JOSHZEPPS @WTP_LIVE

HuffPost political guru Jason Linkins dissects the Foibles of the Clinton Phenomenon... and how Trump might just pull this off.  

@JOSHZEPPS @WTP_LIVE #MakeDebateHealthyAgain

episodes.title: Excerpt-- How we talk about terrorism in wake of Orlando
episodes.summary:
PODCAST’S PRESCIENT DEBATE ON ISLAMISM, HOMOPHOBIA & TERRORISM

In a conversation that now feels tragically relevant, the most recent episode of #WeThePeople LIVE—released the day before the Orlando attack—featured a heated disagreement about Islam, homophobia and terrorism.

The show’s host, Josh Zepps, disagreed with his guests, VICE producers Abdullah Saeed and Anthony Lappe, about how we ought to discuss Islamist terrorism, homophobia and illiberalism. Should progressives claim that jihad "has nothing to do with Islam"? Or does political correctness only leave the door open to anti-Muslim bigotry?

In the aftermath of last night’s horrific events, listen to the exchange and tell us: How do you think we should discuss Islamist violence?


@JoshZepps @WTP_LIVE #MakeDebateHealthyAgain

episodes.title: 36. Hillary Hoe
Ep. 35 So We Publicly Shame LIVE
episodes.summary:
Welcome back humans!

Welcome back our all-star panel from last week, Jon Ronson, Corinne Fisher, Kystyna Hutchinson, and Artie Lange stayed on to discuss something they are truly experts on... shame.  
Jon's last book ("So You've Been Publicly Shamed"which is now available in paperback) dealt with our culture of public shaming, so we thought it'd be fascinating to put him on a stage with people who've made a career talking about their shame, and humiliating others.  

You should let us know if you found it as fascinating as we thought it would be.  @WTP_LIVE @JoshZepps

Make Debate Healthy Again Humans.

 What are they discussing?  Is there any middle ground left? On the right, on the left, in dealing with privacy, in airports not sucking.

episodes.summary:
A very special hour long episode of #WTP LIVE!  Host, Josh Zepps, sits down with the comic philosopher Joe Rogan.  

The two compare their world views on Bernie Sanders, inequality, extremism, and just about everything else you'd expect.  But, they don't just cover the news, they examine whether the current events are showing that the human species is evolving towards an enlightenment.  It's quite the hour.  

Thank you so much for listening.

#WeThePeople LIVE

episodes.summary: Welcome to a WeThePeople doubleheader! Today, Josh had two seperate conversations about what America does best... incarerate people... (sigh). But as always, both of these serious conversations come with snark, and more laughs than should be appropriate. First, Josh talks to Vice's Anthony Lappé to provide the broad view of the problem, then he sits down with Jeffrey Smith, a former Senator, and a former inmate. Enjoy! www.WTPLIVE.com @WTP_Live @JoshZepps Reviews and telling friends makes the sun shine brighter.

Bonus! As Merry As We Get
Ep. 20 But, Would You Eat Your Friend?
episodes.summary: This episode is worth the wait! I know you all have been anxiously staring at your feeds, but the time has come. Josh is joined by three brilliant guest at Pine Box Rock Shop. This week Josh welcomed Lindsay Goldwert, Dan McCoy, and John Opdycke. And they came ready to throw down on everything from survivalism, greed, foreign affairs, and bread. We are so grateful to have guest willing to go in every weird direction we take this show. We are also, even more grateful to have you as a listener. Please subscribe on iTunes #WTP_Live & @JoshZepps www.WTPLive.com

episodes.title: Ep. 19 Sex Ed, Knives, and Trump
episodes.summary: Hello humans! Thank you for joining Josh again for another forty minutes of political mayhem. Remember, just the other day, you asked, "How would a political chat go with a former senator, an English podcaster, a comic, and a tv writer?" Well, enjoy listening to Jeffrey Smith, Felix Salmon, Erica Spera, and Lyle Friedman to find out! This episode has a bit of everything, sex ed talk, personal stories, domestic issues, foreign policy, and of course, the ever less funny GOP presidential candidate. Please subscribe on iTunes #WeThePeople LIVE @WTP_Live & @JoshZepps www.WTPLive.com

Have the Obama years been a liberal or conservative win? And you bet, everyone throws down. Please subscribe on iTunes #WeThePeople LIVE @WTP_Live & @JoshZepps www.WTPLive.com

episodes.summary: Here it is! A very special hour long episode of #WTP LIVE! Host, Josh Zepps, sits down with the comic philosopher Joe Rogan. The two compare their world views on Bernie Sanders, inequality, extremism, and just about everything else you'd expect. But, they don't just cover the news, they examine whether the current events are showing that the human species is evolving towards an enlightenment. It's quite the hour. Thank you so much for listening. Please subscribe on iTunes: #WeThePeople LIVE Please follow us on twitter: @WTP_Live & @JoshZepps www.WTP_Live.com

episodes.title: Ep. 16 College Campus Crazy & Roast Warmup

Josh was joined by Anthony Lappé and the hosts of Guys We Fucked, Krystyna Hutchinson and Corinne Fisher. What's wrestled with this episode? Some pre-show talk about death rituals, and for your main course: what the hell is happening on college campuses, and are liberals too sensitive? O yeah, there's a bit at the end about people's rights to be parents, and there's a lot of ripping on Anthony, basically, this is everything you'd expect from us. Please subscribe on iTunes: #WeThePeople LIVE Please vote for you think won the news @WTP_Live & @JoshZepps Visit our website, www.WTPLive.com, write us a review on iTunes while enjoying a delicious Beach House album. episodes.title: Ep. 15  UNLIVE series: POLITICAL CORRECT CULUTURE
episodes.summary: Welcome to WTPL-Unlive! Our pre-taped series where we tackle one issue for the full half hour! Our first subject up- Political Correctness. What is it? Is it ever good? What's the line between being PC and being a dick? Luckily, Josh is joined by an all-star panel, at Pine Box Rock Shop, to figure it all out. Big thank you to WTPL regular Michael Brooks, a regular for a reason. An equally big thank you for new-comers Chris Hamilton and Samhita Mukhopadhyay, if we can book them regularly they will be regulars as well. episodes.title: Ep.12 Akilah Hughes, Joe Zimmerman, John Opdycke
episodes.summary: Happy end of summer! Happy last episode of #WTP LIVE Season 1!!!! What a journey of Trump jokes, robots, and drunk-ness it has been. And this episode sends us out on a high note. Chill. We are back in October. (Just enough time for you to tell all your Facebook and twitter friends individually about us.) Josh was very fortunate to have a great talk with Akilah Hughes, Joe Zimmerman, and John Opdycke, at Pine Box Rock Shop(are gracious and wonderful venue). Our guest have a tried and true discussion. A long conversation on the future of A.I., a look back at the stories that dominated the summer, the guy with the terrible hair, and term limits. If summer has to end, this is the conversation to celebrate it with. episodes.title: Ep.10 Akilah Hughes, Joanna Rothkopf, Anthony Lappé
episodes.summary: Welcome to the double digits of #WTPL! Thank you for joining the people who listen to the people who bicker at Pine Box Rock Shop in front of the live people. You are them. Mr. Zepps welcomes the multitalented Joanna Rothkopf, Akilah Hughes, and Anthony Lappé. People who are good at their day jobs and very good at being funny about trying to win the news. First you get a double dose of Hillary. Hillary + emails, Hillary + Black Lives Matter. And just when you think this show is leaning right, we talk about Donald Trumps immigration policy. Once the left and the right get taken to task by our guest, they really pull out the outrage regarding the Fat Jew. Check it out, then tweet us your outrage. episodes.title: Ep.9 Jimmy Dore, Debra Wilson, Jenny Churchhill
episodes.summary: Surprise, this episode was taped in LA. You didn't think we'd fly out to LA just to do one show did you? We are sorry that this is not live, but, paradoxically, we are not sorry because it's great. Josh was lucky to be joined by three very interesting, very smart, LA based guest for our second show at Hotel Cafe. Big thank you to Jenny Churchill, Jimmy Dore, and Debra Wilson. With tenacity and comedy the panelist tackle whether it is ethical to be able to delete what comes up in google searches, the sex offenders list, and outer space! How's that for a half hour? Only who's popular.

episodes.title: Ep.8 Jena Friedman, Myq Kaplan, Scott Rogowsky
episodes.summary: Back to Brooklyn! LA was great, but there's nothing like doing a live show back at Pine Box Rock Shop! What a week in news Josh had to discuss with Jena Friedman, Myq Kaplan, and Scott Rogowsky. Big thank you for our three lovely panelist and everyone that came out, what a lively LIVE show. With equal parts irreverence as inptelligencethese news topics travel into more theoretical spaces (in the funniest way possible). Our conversation about Bernie Sander getting interrupted by Black Lives Matter protesters ends with discussing vegans who eat meat... it makes sense in context, promise. The panelist also take on the GOP's performance art. They reflect on Jon Stewart's legacy and farewell. And to close they look at Netflix's new policy, is it for the good, or is there something more cynical? All of this and starfish in this episode! Only who's popular.

episodes.title: Ep.7 Greg Fitzsimmons, Fred Stoller, Zach Cregger

Greg Fitzsimmons, Fred Stoller, and Zach Cregger jumped on the panel at the wonderful Hotel Cafe in Hollywood. Big thank you to the guest, the venue, and the audience. This week you'll hear conversation on Biden's potential presidential bid, the Olympic bidding process, that lion story you've heard about, gamers getting drug tested, and how everyone would like to commit murder! Clearly, this is a can't miss episode. episodes.title: Ep.6 Jamilah Lemieux, Pete Dominick, Michael Kayne
episodes.summary: Welcome back, thank you for stopping what you're doing, listening to this show and reading this description, you're the best. This episode is not quite 'live', it was recorded a week previous, but it is quite the exceptional episode! Josh wrangled and sparred with three equally opinionated and funny guest, Jamilah Lemieux, Pete Dominick, and Michael Kayne. Pine Box Rock Shop hosted the hilarity. We are grateful to the venue and the guest. Josh themed this show around identity and how it shapes our politics. The panel discussed Obama's legacy, race and gender, and immigration policy. Don't worry, there are plenty of laughs along with the soul searching. episodes.title: Ep.5 Dave Hill, Negin Farsad, Andrew Kirell
episodes.summary: Welcome back to a genuinely live #WeThePeople LIVE! Very proud and excited to bring you this great conversation. Josh was honored to quip with Dave Hill, Negin Farad, and Andrew Kirell in front of the hospitable crowd at Pine Box Rock Shop. Starting off you'll be hearing a multidimensional debate about prison reform, Obama's statements inside a prison, jails around the world, and, seriously, jails with taco stands. episodes.title: BONUS! Greeks Talking Greece
episodes.summary: Bonus Short! Josh was in Greece so he took sometime, literally between eating and drinking, to talk to some people. Enjoy accents, food analogies, insightfulness, and opinions that may be right...if you deem them popular. Thank you all for listening. We will have a new, LIVE, episode ready for your ears Monday. episodes.title: Ep.4 Tea Hacic, Mychal Denzel Smith, Anthony Fisher
episodes.summary: Welcome back to #WeThePeople LIVE! As Josh is about to tell you, this is a prerecorded episode, so we took the opportunity to discuss some issues so constant that they get overlooked. Don't worry, things get just as impassioned as our previous episodes. Our panelist bringing the passion this week were Tea Hacic, Mychal Denzel Smith, and Anthony Fisher. We were also honored to have such an engaged audience at Pine Box Rockshop as you're about to hear. This episode you'll hear a discussion about ageism (or is it sexism), gentrification, who's middle class, does France matter, and will computers take over (seriously). All in a half hour! episodes.title: Ep.3 Jim Norton, Juan Thompson, Matt Welch
episodes.summary: Hello humans! Thanks for listening to the first pre-recorded episode of #WeThePeople LIVE! Yes, pre-recorded and a show with live in the title is a bit of a contradiction, but press play and Josh will explain. This episode is delightful, we promise. This week our guest Jim Norton, Juan Thompson, and Matt Welch, joined Josh at Pinebox Rockshop to talk about issues that effect us, the people, all the time. You'll hear heated conversation about American foreign policy, the practices and mentality of the police, and, in Josh's words, "why American elections are so fucking long." episodes.title: Ep.2 Sam Seder, Natasha Lennard, James West
episodes.summary: Welcome back to #WeThePeople LIVE! What a week of news we had to discuss drunk and passionately. We were honored to have Sam Seder, Natasha Lennard, and James West join Josh and the lovely people at Pinebox Rockshop this week. We delve deep into the court's logic about marriage equality, changes in gay identity and what marriage means. Also, with a more eloquent transition than this sentence, the panel debates the recent terrorist attacks around the globe and how America reports on terrorism.
